intro: Psychotria sparsipila, commonly known as the sparse-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and its small, elliptical leaves with a waxy texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent corona. Psychotria sparsipila is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
